company_name: Viet Nam International Commercial Joint Stock Bank
company_profile: Vietnam International Commercial Joint Stock Bank (VIB) was established on 18 September 1996. VIB has its core business in mobilizing capital and crediting. In addition, The Bank also engages in international banking services, trades foreign currencies, financial investment, risk management and capital protection. In 2024, compared to the same period, The net interest margin (NIM) stood at 3.75%, reflecting a decrease of 0.96%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 3.51%, increasing of 0.37%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 50.06%, decreasing of 0.93%. the net profit after tax of the parent company is valued at VND7.2 trillion, decreased 15.87%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 18.06%, down 6.21%.
history_dev: September 18, 1996: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank was established with an initial charter capital of VND50 billion; 2006: Increased the charter capital to VND 1,000 billion; 2007: Increased the charter capital to VND 2,000 billion; 2009: Increased the charter capital to VND 3,000 billion; 2010: Increased the charter capital to VND 4,000 billion; 2007: Became a public company; 2008: Signed the comprehensive economic cooperation agreement with the Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA). 2016: Increased the charter capital to VND5,644 billion; January 09, 2017: Traded on UPCOM market; December 27, 2018: Increased the charter capital to VND7,834 billion; December 02, 2019: Increased charter capital to VND9.224 billion; October 16, 2020: Listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); October 30, 2020: Cancelled the transaction registration on the UPCOM market; November 10, 2020: Officially traded on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); January 28, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND11,093 billion; September 08, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND15,531 billion; July 6, 2022: Increased charter capital to VND 21,076 billion; August 23, 2023: Increased charter capital to VND25,368.07 billion; December 5, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND29,791.27 billion; August 14, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND34,040.05 billion;
business_risk: The risks of political instability and trade war are increasing, and the global financial markets may be impacted by the trend of accelerating the normalization of monetary policies in key economies (such as the US, UK, EU...). Adverse fluctuations in interest rates, exchange rates, stock prices, foreign currencies, and commodity prices in the market. Risks may arise when borrowers do not comply with the terms of the credit contract, causing financial losses and difficulties in the bank's business operations. This may occur if the bank is unable to provide sufficient cash for immediate liquidity needs, or can provide enough but at a high cost. The bank cannot meet the requirements of payment contracts. Risks may occur during the operation of the bank, such as risks from human error, failure to comply with rules and procedures leading to losses, errors or violations of laws. Risks of asset losses occur due to inefficient operations, such as incomplete information systems, problematic operations, violations in the internal control system, fraud or unforeseeable disasters.
key_developments: Mobilizing capital; Granting credit; Financial investment and cooperation; Trading foreign currencies; International banking; Risk management and capital protection;
business_strategies: For small and medium enterprises (SME): Expanding business centers to serve SME customers in big provinces and cities, including Ho Chi Minh, Hanoi, Danang, Vung Tau, Can Tho, Dong Nai, Binh Duong, Nha Trang, Vinh, Thanh Hoa, Hai Phong, Quang Ninh, and Thai Binh with intention to develop credit strongly in this segment. For individual customers: VIB provides individual customers not only with capital mobilization or lending products but also other services such as Master card, ATM card, ebank bill payment... For large enterprises: VIB continues to provide credit packages for large enterprises, corporations with healthy stable financial position operating in prioritized sectors in accordance with the orientation of Vietnam Government. Besides, VIB also develops and provides specified products for subsidiaries under the large enterprises and corporation. For prioritized sectors: VIB focuses on develop credit in sectors prioritized by Vietnam Government, mainly SME customers, import and export enterprises, support technologies, agriculture and rural development.
